```{r}
library(shiny)

# ASCII sugar skull with flowers data - courtesy of Posit's Shiny Assistant
create_sugar_skull_data <- function() {
  skull_lines <- c(
    "    ðŸŒ¸       ðŸŒº       ðŸŒ¸",
    "  ðŸŒº   .-~*~*~*~-.   ðŸŒº",
    "      /  â™¦ â™¦ â™¦ â™¦  \\",
    " ðŸŒ¸  | â™¦ @ â™¦ â™¦ @ â™¦ |  ðŸŒ¸",
    "     | â™¦ â™¦ â™¦^â™¦ â™¦ â™¦ |",
    " ðŸŒº  | * â™¦ â™¦â™¦â™¦ â™¦ * |  ðŸŒº",
    "     | â™¦   â™¦â™¦â™¦   â™¦ |",
    " ðŸŒ¸  | * â™¦ |â™¦â™¦| â™¦ * |  ðŸŒ¸",
    "     | â™¦ * \\___/ * â™¦|",
    " ðŸŒº   \\ â™¦*~*~*~*â™¦ /   ðŸŒº",
    "       '-*~â™¦~â™¦~*-'",
    "    ðŸŒ¸   ðŸŒº   ðŸŒº   ðŸŒ¸"
  )
  
  # Convert to data frame with x, y coordinates and characters
  skull_data <- data.frame()
  
  for (y in seq_along(skull_lines)) {
    line <- skull_lines[y]
    chars <- strsplit(line, "")[[1]]
    
    for (x in seq_along(chars)) {
      if (chars[x] != " ") {  # Only include non-space characters
        # Classify characters by type for coloring
        char_type <- case_when(
          chars[x] %in% c("@") ~ "eyes",
          chars[x] %in% c("â™¦") ~ "diamonds",
          chars[x] %in% c("*") ~ "stars",
          chars[x] %in% c("^") ~ "nose",
          chars[x] %in% c("|", "\\", "/", "_") ~ "mouth",
          chars[x] %in% c("~") ~ "decoration",
          chars[x] %in% c("ðŸŒ¸", "ðŸŒº") ~ "flowers",
          TRUE ~ "outline"
        )
        
        skull_data <- rbind(skull_data, data.frame(
          x = x,
          y = length(skull_lines) - y + 1,  # Flip y-axis
          char = chars[x],
          type = char_type
        ))
      }
    }
  }
  
  return(skull_data)
}

```

## MelodÃ­a Ancestral

I asked Posit's [**Shiny Assistant**](https://gallery.shinyapps.io/assistant) to make some AASCI art in [`{ggplot2}`](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/) and a [Sugar Skull designer app](https://amelialouise.shinyapps.io/everybody-git-together/). 

@fig-skull shows the magnificent MelodÃ­a Ancestral, which Shiny also named. Neat.

```{r}
#| label: fig-skull
#| fig-cap: Shiny Assistant's ASCII sugar skull art
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
data <- create_sugar_skull_data()
    
    ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y, label = char, color = type)) +
      geom_text(size = 5, family = "mono") +
      scale_color_manual(values = c(
        "eyes" = "#FF1493",      # Deep pink for eyes
        "diamonds" = "#00CED1",  # Dark turquoise for diamonds
        "stars" = "#FFD700",     # Gold for stars
        "nose" = "#FF4500",      # Orange red for nose
        "mouth" = "#8A2BE2",     # Blue violet for mouth
        "decoration" = "#32CD32", # Lime green for decorations
        "flowers" = "#FF69B4",   # Hot pink for flowers
        "outline" = "#DC143C"    # Crimson for outline
      )) +
      theme_void() +
      theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "black", color = "black"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "black", color = "black"),
        strip.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),
        legend.position = "none"
      )
```
